experience.project_name: Science and Technology Policy Fellow in the Office of Advanced Cyberinfrastructure

institution.name: National Science Foundation
department_program: Computer and Information Science and Engineering

experience.description: As a AAAS STPF Fellow placed in the Office of Advanced Cyberinfrastructure (OAC)

experience.project_name: Anatomically informed segmentation of white matter
experience.description: As a postdoctoral researcher I produced automated segmentation methods for major white matter tracts in tractography using cross-species and literature-based information. This also entailed the visualization of tractography and segmentation results, as well as the quantification of tract properties. To ensure the repicability and stability of these products I developed, documented, and maintained several code repositories.

experience.project_name: Associative white matter tracts in the human brain

institution.name: Indiana University Bloomington
department_program: Department of Psychological and Brain Sciences

experience.description: As a graduate student I developed and implemented automated segmentation methods for major white matter tracts in tractography. This also entailed the visualization of tractography and segmentation results, as well as the quantification of tract properties and development of tractography quality assurance methods. This work required a deep review of contemporary and historical neuroanatomy literature.

institution.name: Indiana University Bloomington
department_program: Department of Psychological and Brain Sciences

experience.description: In this role I was responsible for the production and maintanence of containerized data processing applications for the brainlife.io platform. This entailed the creation of novel data processing and visualization code, as well as adaptation of exisiting resources.  I also engaged in testing, monitoring, and feedback on service deployment and coordination.  I also led the scoping, creation, coordinaton, and maintanence of specific data formats/standards.

non_technical: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment (CI/CD) Methods

experience.project_name: Open Source Software, Trends in Contributions and Collaborations; Army Performance Measurement, Content and Themes
experience.description: As a Research Fellow, I served as participant lead for two projects.  Also in this capacity, I developed/produced code, analyses (qualitative and quantitative), and web content. Additionally, I performed performed data curation/cleaning, linked datasets, created visualizations, presented insights, and managed interns.

experience.project_name: Identification of zebrafish brain regions involved with stress response via in-situ hybridization for c-fos
experience.description: As an undergraduate research assistant I ran experiments, collected and analyzed data, prepared and processed biological samples, maintained subject stocks, developed grants, and presented research results.

experience.project_name: Regeneration of thymic tissue and function using a mouse model

institution.name: Wake Forest University
department_program: Wake Forest Institute for Regenerative Medicine (WFIRM)

experience.description: As a summer research scholar I engaged in a focused an intensive research project.  This project was centered arount characterizing and calibrating the process for producing functional thymic organoids.  I assisted with sample production, processing, and analysis, in addition to also presenting on project status and findings.  This work was supported by a SENS Research Foundation Summer research fellowship.

experience.project_name: Investigation of endogenous and exogenous attentional control using attentional blink paradigm

institution.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

experience.description: As an undergraduate research assistant I aided with research and data collection for projects involving EEG and tracking using the attentional blink paradigm.

experience.project_name: Investigating the genetic basis of Fusarium wilt resistance in melons
experience.description: As pre-accalaureate research assistant, I was trained to assist with a number of research production processes, including both work in the field and at the lab-bench.

institution.name: Indiana University Bloomington
institution.department_program: Department of Psychological and Brain Sciences

experience.description: Across four semesters as a graduate teaching assistant, I provided assistance with grading and classroom management, led discussion sections, and held office hours for various courses in research methods and statistics, cognitive neuroscience, and social neuroscience.
As a graduate teaching assistant for GN 311 - Principles of Genetics, I led discussion sections, lectured and reviewed, held office hours, and graded course assignments and tests.

As a graduate teaching assistant, I provided assistance for a number of philosophy courses with grading and classroom management, led discussion sections, and held office hours for various courses in ethics, introduction to philosophy, political philosophy, and classical philosophy.

As a psychology instructor at Duke TIP, I led an intensive and comprehensive introduction to psychology for academically gifted high school students.  This course was taught at a 101 level and covered the standard range of topics that would be expected in a first-year college course.
As a psychology teaching assistant at Duke TIP, I provided assistance with grading and classroom management, and led daily review sessions.
As a nanotechnology teaching assistant at Duke TIP, I provided assistance with grading and classroom management, and led daily review sessions.

institution.name: Indiana University Bloomington
institution.department_program: Indiana University Graduate and Professional Student Government

experience.description: As chair of the Benefits committee in the Indiana University Graduate and Professional Student Government (GPSG), I represented and advocated on behalf of graduate and professional students on issues related to compensation, benefits, and professional issues. I regularly met and communicated with university administrators, including the Dean of University Graduate School, about policy development, mutual endeavors, and specific concerns. I was also a member of the GPSG executive committee and managed a team of graduate student representatives.

As a member of the technology poicy commitee, I represented Indiana University graduate student researchers on campus issues related to technology implementation. Regular meeting topics of this group included virtual conferencing (e.g. Zoom), email and data platforms, and research data storage and ownership.

As a member of the Research Affairs Commitee I represented graduate student researchers on campus issues related to research affairs. Regular meeting topics included COVID impacts, conflict of interest management, research disclosures, campus open access policies, NTT researchers, and other subjects. Worked with campus stakeholders and administrators from the Office of Research Administration, Office of the Vice Provost for Research, and others.

As a voting member of the Bloomington Faculty Council (BFC), I represented graduate student researchers on all matters coming before the council, including campus-level policy, resolutions, and campus development planning.  I often met or interacted with campus/university administrators on specific issues and persistent ad hoc committees.

In this role I represented graduate students from the Program in Neuroscience to the Graduate and Professional Student Government. As a representative I helped to shape and develop resolutions, and was overall an active member.

As Vice President of the NCSU Future Society Club, I led meetings, scheduled and organized talks, and managed membership. Meeting topics included technology, science, society, and the interplay between these.
As the chief editor of the undergraduate research journal I evaluated submissions and provided feedback to authors. I also collaborated with faculty in support of organization.
